meaningMnemonic: A <radical>person</radical> puts a <radical>lid</radical> on their <radical>cross</radical> after they <kanji>graduate</kanji>. It’s a symbolic gesture, putting the lid over the cross, but it’s just what you do when you graduate around these parts.
readingMnemonic: Oops, looks like you forgot your lid. Without the lid, you’ll be held back. <reading>So two</reading> (そつ) more years now until you can graduate. So two more years, eh? Just for forgetting a lid? Nonsense!
